column1: 2001: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring:
:Radagast is entirely omitted. Without Radagasts involvement
column2: Gandalf goes to Isengard of his own accord (because he wanted counsel from Saruman) and is able to escape from the pinnacle of Orthanc by speaking to a moth who sends for the help of the Eagles.

column1: :Although Radagast is only briefly mentioned in The Hobbit
column2: Radagast features in The Hobbit films and is played by Sylvester McCoy. He is highly eccentric and somewhat absent-minded
column3: and also uses a sled pulled by several large rabbits (which he refers to as Rhosgobel Rabbits) as his main means of transportation.

column1: :After discovering that a shadow has fallen on Mirkwood (having had to heal his hedgehog friend Sebastian because of its power)
column2: Radagast enters Dol Guldur and is attacked by the Witch-king. He finds that the fortress is occupied by a Sauron#Saurons Return and travels to inform Gandalf. He finds Thorin and Company just west of Rivendell and hands Gandalf a Morgul-knife. He draws a pack of Wargs and their Orcs riders away on his rabbit-pulled sled so that Thorin and Company can flee in safety.

column1: 2013: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug:

column2: investigating the High Fells of Rhudaur with Gandalf
column3: and accompanying him to Dol Guldur. Gandalf then dispatches him to send news of what theyve found to Galadriel
column4: while Gandalf enters the fortress ruins alone.

column1: 2014: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies:
:Radagast first appears when he comes in Dol Guldur during the Attack on Dol Guldur by the White Council to take the weakened Gandalf to safety. After they escape
column3: takes Radagasts staff and also commands him to summon bird and beast for the impending Battle of Five Armies. He arrives with the Eagles late in the battle along with Beorn. They demolish the Orc forces and effectively help end the Battle of Five Armies.

column1: 1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:Donald Gee provided the voice of Radagast. He is introduced much earlier than in the book because his meeting with Gandalf is given chronologically.

:Radagast has been issued in a couple of different versions: figure LR3 "Radagast the Brown" is seen with a cat and an owl;http://www.mithril.ie/races/index_wizards.html Mithril wizards Miniatures at http://www.mithril.ie/ Mithril.ie (accessed 8 October 2011) an older version of the figure portrays Radagast without beard and with a different bird.http://www.twilighttangents.com/minis_lotr_mith.htm Lord of the Rings (Mithril) at http://www.twilighttangents.com/index.html TwilightTangents.com (accessed 8 October 2011; cf. http://www.twilighttangents.com/images/art/radagast01.jpg Radgast (image)) There is also a "Radagast Mounted" (MS539)
column2: where Radagast (again without beard) is portrayed mounted on a horse.http://mithril.ie/Fellowship/ms539_radagast.html 32mm Fellowship Figures - MS539 Radagast Mounted at http://www.mithril.ie/ Mithril.ie (accessed 8 October 2011)

column1: 1988: J.R.R. Tolkiens War in Middle Earth:
:Radagast is a non-playable character in this game.
2001-: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game:

column2: is a user of subtle magics
column3: in contrast to the more overt kinds used by Gandalf and Saruman. However
column4: he has some unique powers nonetheless.http://www.games-workshop.com/gws/catalog/productDetail.jsp?prodId=prod1060255 Radagast the Brown at http://www.games-workshop.com/gws/home.jsp Games-Workshop-com (accessed 8 October 2011)

column1: 2011-2010: The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game:
:A Decipher card was made by Weta Workshop
column2: with Wetas John Harding posing as Radagast.

column1: 2007-: The Lord of the Rings Online:
:Radagast can be found encamped in the Lone-lands
column2: north along the Great Road. He is friendly to the local people
column4: and helps them to combat the rise of evil in the swamps of Agamaur.http://lorebook.lotro.com/wiki/NPC:Radagast_the_Brown NPC: Radagast the Brown at http://my.lotro.com/home/ My.Lotro.com (accessed 8 October 2011)

column1: 2011: The Lord of the Rings: War in the North:

column2: Farin and Andriel travel to Mirkwood in search of Radagast and arrive just in time to rescue him from the Spider Queen
column3: Saenathra. He thanks them for the rescue and provides them with information about the Dragon Urgost.http://www.warinthenorth.com/index.php/the-game/allies Allies at http://www.warinthenorth.com/ WarintheNorth.com (accessed 8 October 2011)

column2: based on Peter Jacksons The Hobbit (film series)
column3: is a hero figurine in two different versions: the standard model "Radagast the Brown with Sebastian"
column4: and a limited model sold with the box The Hobbit: Escape from Goblin Town.
